message: Honored to be sworn in today to represent #NY04 in the 115th Congress, and excited to announce that we've moved to a new, more accessible District Office on Long Island. Stop in and see us at 229 7th Street, Suite #300, Garden City, NY 11530!

Thanks to all those who spoke out yesterday against the ridiculous House Republican plan to gut the Office of Congressional Ethics. Never been more important for all of us to work together and ensure that public officials remain fully accountable to the people they serve.
Det. Steven McDonald is an extraordinary human being and an inspiration to all who know him. Please keep him, Malverne Mayor Patti McDonald and their family in your prayers this weekend.

Praying for all those in Jerusalem after the despicable attack today that left four young Israeli soldiers dead and several wounded. This was an act of terrorism and cowardice, not heroism and courage. The U.S. will continue to stand with Israel as they work to protect the Israeli people and pursue lasting peace.

New York lost an extraordinary human being today. Blessed to have known him. Praying for Mayor McDonald, their son Conor, all their loved ones and all of Det. McDonald's brothers and sisters in the NYPD. Rest in peace.
Merrick #NY04 native Noah Rubin takes on Roger Federer tonight in the second round of the Australian Open! Congratulations and good luck!!!
Expecting continued heavy rain and high winds tonight on Long Island. Urge everyone to be safe, follow updates and stay off the roads if you can.

Republicans and Democrats should be working together to help create jobs and strengthen security. Instead, first major House vote under President Trump was on anti-choice bill that will make reproductive health care services less accessible and less affordable.

This executive order betrays basic American values for the sake of nationalistic, fearmongering campaign promises. Refugees are already vetted more exhaustively than anyone who’s admitted to this country, and we should always be looking for ways to keep strengthening all of our security procedures. But that’s not what this order is about. President Trump wants to keep Muslims out, as he’s said himself, and he wants us to turn our backs on the most vulnerable people in the world in the midst of a global refugee crisis. This is what President Trump calls "America First," and it’s the very definition of un-American.

Tonight, Acting Attorney General Sally Yates is leaving the Department of Justice on a high note, demonstrating the courage and integrity that have characterized her entire career. President Trump’s executive order is legally and morally indefensible, and I thank Acting AG Yates for doing the right thing despite the consequences.  As a former federal prosecutor, I served under both Democratic and Republican presidents, and I believe the DOJ should always be independent, objective, and non-partisan. Right now, President Trump is making the DOJ look like a joke. He’s making every federal prosecutor in the country feel like a joke. The so-called ‘law and order candidate’ has no regard for law and order, and that’s a threat to every pillar of our democracy.

I’m honored to have the opportunity to lead the Democratic members on the Counterterrorism and Intelligence Subcommittee. This Subcommittee has an important responsibility right now to provide effective oversight of DHS, continue to make our intelligence-sharing efforts more efficient across all levels of government and law enforcement, and ensure that the men and women who keep us safe have the information and resources they need. I look forward to working with Chairman King and I hope we can fulfill that responsibility in a constructive, bipartisan way.
Time for President Trump to Twitter-shame another U.S. company (and, again, also release his tax returns, divest, etc.)
Unacceptable.

Vladimir Putin has murdered political opponents, invaded a neighboring country, hacked an American presidential election, and used his power to enrich himself and his friends, all while driving the Russian economy into the ground. We need to find out why President Trump is so obviously afraid of criticizing Putin, and we need to do everything in our power to make sure Trump’s America never looks anything like Putin’s Russia.
Expecting as much as 8-12 inches in Nassau County tomorrow, with possibility of heavy snow during the morning commute. Urge everyone to be prepared, follow updates and stay safe!
This is the President of the United States trying to intimidate companies that don't do business with his family members. That is unacceptable.

In the past week, two of President Trump’s top spokespeople have repeatedly made public statements referencing terrorist attacks that simply did not occur. That is as dangerous as it is incompetent. We cannot allow this administration to distort the facts when it comes to national security. We cannot allow them to use the very real threat of terrorism as a tool to stoke fears for their political purposes. The American people need to know that this President will keep us safe and confront that threat like a serious adult. It’s extremely disturbing that right now, he seems more focused on telling people who to blame when the next attack comes.

Federal ethics rules: "An employee shall not use his[/her] public office for...the endorsement of any product, service or enterprise, or for the private gain of friends, relatives, or persons with whom the employee is affiliated in a nongovernmental capacity."  Again, unacceptable.
Please share: If ICE agents come to your door, know your rights.
Si agentes de ICE llegan a su casa, usted debe saber cuáles son sus derechos.
Kathleen speaking in support of her bill to help boost veteran employment, which PASSED UNANIMOUSLY in the House tonight!
Joined Wolf Blitzer on The Situation Room last night to discuss the Russian spy ship on the east coast, the Trump campaign's contacts with Russia, and Michael Flynn's resignation

My remarks today on the House floor: We need to put politics aside, do what's right for our democracy, and create an independent commission to fully investigate Russia's influence on the Trump administration and the presidential election.

I’m deeply disturbed by the recent bomb threats targeting Jewish Community Centers. Whoever is responsible for these despicable crimes wants Jewish communities to live in fear and lose faith in these trusted religious, cultural and social institutions. But Jewish communities on Long Island and across the country are too strong to be terrorized by a hateful coward with a telephone and a voice distorter, and we must all stand in absolute solidarity with our Jewish friends and neighbors during this difficult time. I urge law enforcement agencies at all levels across the country to fully investigate these crimes, and I’ll continue working with Jewish leaders in our district to address any security concerns and ensure they have the assistance they need to keep their communities safe.

Joined many of my House colleagues today to call on United States Department of Homeland Security, The United States Department of Justice, & FBI – Federal Bureau of Investigation to immediately and fully investigate the recent wave of bomb threats targeting Jewish Community Centers across the country.
Excited to hear from so many constituents interested in a town hall! We're planning one for next weekend in #NY04. Finalizing details and will announce soon!
We're hosting a Town Hall on SATURDAY in #NY04. We'll be in the auditorium at Mineola Middle School at 10:00 a.m. Hope to see you there!

KATHLEEN'S STATEMENT ON THE PRESIDENT'S JOINT ADDRESS TO CONGRESS: “President Trump might’ve struck a more presidential tone tonight, but I care about substance  — and this speech had none. It was all talk, no details, and no real plan for action. He spent more time distorting facts and defending his chaotic first month in office than he did explaining how he’ll create jobs and boost wages for working people. I care about sincerity — and again, this speech had none. We have no way to know what this president actually believes and no reason to trust anything he says.”

Attorney General Jeff Sessions is now the second Trump administration official who concealed his contacts with Russia during the campaign, and he should be the second Trump administration official to resign for doing so. Even if there was nothing inappropriate about his conversations with the Russian ambassador, he had an opportunity to disclose that to Congress, and he chose not to. That may or may not mean he committed a criminal offense, but it certainly means that he lacks the credibility to lead the Justice Department.

The President and the White House are either once again lying to the American people, or seeking to interfere in an ongoing FBI investigation — possibly both. Presidents, thankfully, can’t order wiretaps, and Congress doesn’t conduct investigations based on bizarre tweets and Breitbart News reports. If President Trump wants to get to the bottom of these so-called "reports," he should come out in support of an independent, nonpartisan commission to investigate Russia’s interference in our election and everything related to it. If he has nothing to hide, then he has nothing to lose and everything to gain.

“If what the president says is true, that this travel restriction is all about national security, then show us the analysis that has been done on all those underlying requests that were a part of the original travel ban. If this really is about national security and keeping our country safe...prove it."

Preet Bharara is an outstanding prosecutor who has served New Yorkers with integrity, honor, and a relentless commitment to the pursuit of justice. The decision to demand his resignation and that of 45 other U.S. Attorneys, while not without precedent, raises serious questions in light of President Trump’s bizarre allegations of illegal wiretaps and his administration's attempts to interfere with ongoing investigations.  Did that decision come from the Justice Department, or the White House? Was the decision prompted by the President watching Fox News on Thursday night, when Sean Hannity called for a purge of Obama appointees? Why did President Trump ask Preet Bharara to stay on in November, only to demand his resignation a few months later? Was the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York conducting investigations in any way related to President Trump or his associates, and did that have anything to do with Preet Bharara’s refusal to resign? Until the President and his administration answer these questions, they don’t deserve the benefit of the doubt and we have no reason to trust that the Justice Department will maintain the level of independence, integrity and credibility that the American people demand.
Blizzard warning for most of Long Island tomorrow. Urge everyone to be prepared, avoid travel if possible, & stay safe!
Ideologues behind Congressional Republicans' health care bill are basically setting up survival of the fittest: If you have money, you can get quality health care. If you don't, you're out of luck.

A few details on some of the homeland security funding NYC/LI-area would lose under President Trump's budget: Urban Areas Security Initiative helps high-density/-threat areas prevent & respond to terrorist acts: #TrumpCuts NYC-area funding by $44.6 million. State Homeland Security Program supports states' counterterrorism prevention, response, and recovery efforts: #TrumpCuts NY's funding by $19.2 million. Transit Security Grant Program helps protect transportation infrastructure: #TrumpCuts funding for MTA, NYPD & PANYNJ by $7.3 million. Port Security Grant Program: #TrumpCuts funding for NY/NJ by $5.2 million  Congress won't allow these cuts. But with all of President Trump's talk about national security, have to wonder why he'd propose them in the first place.
Wishing everyone a Happy St. Patrick's Day! If you're celebrating tonight, have fun, make a plan to get home safe, and don't let anyone you know drink and drive. Sláinte!

This is a choice that no human being should ever be forced to make. Please Like and Share if you agree: Victims of domestic violence and other crimes should have NO reason to fear that pursuing justice in court could lead to detention or deportation!

I am shocked and saddened by the death of Martin McGuinness. Martin was many things to many people in his life, but through it all, he was a patriot who had relentless faith in the future of Northern Ireland. Amid the violence and despair of the Troubles, Martin believed that peace was possible, and his leadership helped make it a reality.   I saw Martin at the White House St. Patrick’s Day party just over a year ago. President Obama walked by us on his way out, after working the room and shaking hands for hours, and he looked like he had somewhere important to be. But Martin decided that my 90-year-old Irish Aunt Ellen needed a picture with the President, so he grabbed President Obama’s arm with a laugh and made him stand with us while Martin took our picture. I’m grateful to have that memory of Martin and feel blessed to have known him.  I offer my prayers and condolences to Martin’s wife, children and loved ones and to his colleagues and friends around the world. His life is a testament to humanity’s capacity to change, to choose peace over violence and reconcile even the most intractable conflicts. I hope that his legacy will inspire all political leaders in Northern Ireland to reaffirm their own commitment to the ongoing pursuit of lasting peace and prosperity.”

Today the House voted 414-2 to pass my bill to improve TSA's technology acquisition process. Grateful to my colleagues for giving this bill such broad bipartisan support. Click the link below for more details!

The GOP health care bill being rushed to the floor today is getting worse with every backroom deal made to lock down votes. It was bad enough to take insurance away from 24 million hardworking Americans, make seniors pay more for coverage, and de-fund Planned Parenthood. But then they added an amendment that will decimate Medicaid funding for Long Islanders and upstate New Yorkers. And now they're reportedly considering stripping requirements that all insurance plans cover Essential Health Benefits, including mental health and addiction treatment, pregnancy/maternity/newborn care, and preventive services, among others.   Please LIKE and SHARE to help spread the word before this bill comes to a vote!

Wearing pink today to #StandwithPP and the millions of women who rely on them. House may vote today on GOP health care bill that would de-fund Planned Parenthood. But whatever happens, our fight has just begun.
THANK YOU to everyone from #NY04 who called, wrote and spoke out against the GOP health care bill! The fight isn't over, but you made your voices heard & this is your victory.

Great time at the Rockville Centre St. Patrick's Day Parade this weekend! With Legislator Laura Curran, Malverne Mayor (and Grand Marshall) Patti McDonald, Todd Kaminsky and parade organizer Andrew Healey

An investigation is only as credible as those who lead it, and Chairman Nunes sacrificed his credibility. He must recuse himself, and Republicans in Congress must join us in appointing an independent, non-partisan commission to lead the investigation into Russia's attack on our democracy.
Discussing a lot of important issues related to the critical US-Israel relationship with #NY04 constituents in town for #AIPAC2017. Great to see so many of you in DC!

President Trump and Scott Pruitt deny basic science and do what big oil companies tell them to do, even when it means jeopardizing our national security, environment, and public health. But it’s people in places like Long Island who will pay the price of polluted air, rising sea levels and extreme weather events like superstorm Sandy.   We have an opportunity on Long Island and across New York to create a lot of good local jobs by leading the transition to clean energy. I’m going to keep working to make sure we seize that opportunity, even if the Trump administration continues to deny basic facts and lead us in the opposite direction.
Great meeting today with my friends from Planned Parenthood of Nassau County. We can always count on you to be there for those who need you, and you can always count on me to #StandWithPP!

Today is #EqualPayDay, symbolizing how far into the year women must work to catch up to what men earned last year. The fight for equal pay isn't just about justice for working women - it's also about unleashing women's potential to fully participate in our local and national economies. We must take comprehensive action to close the wage gap and ensure that all women in America earn equal pay for equal work. Every day we fail to act is a missed economic opportunity that we'll never get back.

Kathleen and Mike Quigley lead call to prevent suspected terrorists from buying guns: “With all of President Trump’s talk about protecting the homeland and combating terrorism, preventing suspected terrorists from buying guns should be a no brainer for both parties in Congress,” said Representative Kathleen Rice, a Vice Chair of the House Gun Violence Prevention Task Force. “No matter how entrenched this debate might be, we should all agree that an individual considered too dangerous to board a plane shouldn’t be able to walk into a store and buy a semi-automatic weapon. The American people – Democrats, Republicans, gun owners, and even NRA members – overwhelmingly support action to close this loophole, and it would be unconscionable for Congress to let another year go by without getting it done.”
Joined fellow former prosecutors Ted Lieu and Congresswoman Stacey Plaskett today to request a Special Prosecutor to investigate possible collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia.
Great time talking with #NY04 students yesterday from East Meadow High School's Model Congress and Social Studies Honor Society. Hope you're all enjoying your trip to DC!
Wishing a blessed & peaceful Passover to all who are celebrating in #NY04 & around the world!
Heartbroken over the school shooting in San Bernardino yesterday and praying for the entire community. A parent's worst nightmare.

President Trump was briefed on classified intel reports, and then accused former National Security Adviser Susan Rice of a crime. Now, Republicans and Democrats in Congress have reviewed those same reports and "found no evidence that Obama administration officials did anything unusual or illegal."  This is a democracy. The President of the United States cannot falsely accuse an American citizen of committing a crime and then move on as if it never happened.
Saddened to learn that former US Ambassador to Ireland Dan Rooney has passed. Thoughts are with his family, friends and loved ones around the world. Pray that he will rest in peace.

Met with CSEA Local 1000 members today to discuss our ongoing efforts to protect and improve key health care programs that so many New Yorkers rely on. Thanks for coming and for all your advocacy on behalf of working men and women in #NY04!

Thanks to NYSUT United members Kenneth Ulric, Jennifer Evans-DiCrescio and Ed Kent for coming in to our #NY04 yesterday to discuss our fight to protect the promise of public education for all American students!
Met yesterday with new Hempstead (village), New York Mayor Don Ryan, Dr. David Gates, Deputy Mayor Perry Pettus, and Rev. Dr. Sedgwick Easley. Look forward to working with you all!

As tensions rise with North Korea, the U.S. needs to prioritize the appointment of Ambassadors to South Korea and Japan, two of our closest allies. We need serious diplomats on the ground in order to reach a diplomatic solution.

President Trump's misleading statements about the USS Vinson - and the White House's flat-out refusal to take responsibility for it today - further highlight this administration's dangerous lack of credibility. Our allies need to know that we'll be there when they need us, and the entire world needs to know that when we speak, we mean it.

Thrilled to announce that 11-year-old Zoie Napolitano from Oceanside #NY04 has received an Environmental Champion Award from EPA Region 2 for her efforts to lead the clean up of Silver Lake Park! Congratulations, Zoie!!!

President Trump ran on "extreme vetting" for immigrants and refugees, then picked a National Security Adviser who was an unregistered foreign agent and failed to disclose payments from Russia while seeking a security clearance.
My thoughts are with William Tolley's family, friends and fellow firefighters today as they gather to lay him to rest. Keeping you all in my prayers.
Pro tip for AG Jeff Sessions as he comes to Long Island today: Yes, MS-13 is a serious threat. But you won't be able to touch them if the immigrant community is afraid to talk to you.

#NY04 and the Five Towns community lost a great man this weekend. I offer my deepest condolences to Rabbi Binyomin Kamenetzky's family, friends and all those whose lives he touched during his time with us. I feel blessed to have known him and pray that he rests in peace.
I think President Trump may be the only person on the planet who doesn't accept the fact that Russia interfered in our elections and attacked our democracy.

A lot of folks from #NY04 calling our offices to speak out against #Trumpcare. This bill was awful in March, and it's even worse now. I will of course vote NO, and I'm grateful to all who are making their voices heard.  Calls, letters and emails on the Republican health care bill over the past two weeks:  OPPOSE: 730 (97.6%) SUPPORT: 18 (2.4%)

My full statement on today's #Trumpcare vote:  “The Republican health care bill was awful in March, and the version that passed today is even worse. It still completely decimates Medicaid to finance a huge tax cut for the rich, it still increases costs on seniors, and it’s still an attack on women that would de-fund Planned Parenthood. Now, it also allows insurers to discriminate against people with preexisting conditions, and it allows states to opt out of essential health benefit requirements for things like maternity care and drug addiction treatment.  “House Republicans rushed to pass this bill before anyone could know how many more people would lose coverage – just to fulfill a campaign promise, give President Trump a so-called ‘win,’ and dump this disaster off on the Senate. Some members even admitted that they’d vote for it just so the Senate can change it and send back a completely different bill. Today’s vote was a win for the wealthy and the Washington way of doing business, and a devastating loss for everyone else in America.    “My constituents spoke out emphatically against this bill, and I will keep fighting to defeat this effort and advance real solutions that will actually make health care more affordable for everyone. We may have lost today, but our fight will continue.”
President Trump just fired the FBI Director in the midst of an ongoing FBI investigation into the Trump campaign. This is a crisis.
To me, Trump's decision to fire Comey and his threatening Tweets today about secret "tapes" show a President who's becoming more and more unhinged.

78% of Americans support an independent investigation of Russia's interference in the 2016 elections. Please Like and Share this post if you agree that we need a special prosecutor and an independent, non-partisan commission to get the facts and prevent this from happening in the future.
The Comey firing made it clear that President Trump wants an FBI Director who is loyal to Trump above all else. Anyone who fits that description is unfit for the job.

President Trump revealed highly classified intel to the Russian Foreign Minister and Ambassador in the Oval Office, at a time when our closest allies were already questioning whether the Trump administration could be trusted with shared intelligence. As I said last week when he fired the FBI Director, this is a crisis. Please read and SHARE to help keep others informed.
I was a prosecutor for more than 20 years. If someone connected to an ongoing investigation ever told me "I hope you can let this go," I'd hear sirens.
Great run this morning for a great cause (Fidelco Guide Dog Foundation). Thanks to my teammates and thanks American Council of Life Insurers for making it happen! #CapChallenge

Appointing a special prosecutor to oversee this investigation is a positive and necessary step. While I don’t know Robert Mueller personally, his reputation and record of service suggest that he will bring a desperately needed level of independence and credibility to this investigation. I want to thank the many Long Islanders from across the political spectrum who have spoken up about this issue in recent weeks. I will keep making your voices heard and keep fighting for accountability from this administration.

2017 CONGRESSIONAL ART COMPETITION & PEOPLE’S CHOICE AWARD: Big thanks to the 28 high school students in our district who submitted amazing work for the 2017 Congressional Art Competition! The winner will be selected on June 5th by a panel of judges from Adelphi University and will be displayed in the Capitol for one year.   This year we’re also excited to announce the People’s Choice Award! The piece that receives the most LIKES by Sunday, JUNE 4th will be displayed in our Garden City office. Please LIKE your favorite piece and SHARE this album to help spread the word!
Only cowards would target kids at a concert. Praying for the victims and all who are working to recover from this despicable attack.

The recent problems at Penn Station have been a nightmare for Long Islanders who depend on – and more importantly, pay for – reliable public transportation to and from New York City, and Amtrak’s summer construction plans will make this crisis even worse in the short-term. After speaking with Governor Cuomo yesterday, I joined many of my fellow New York delegation members in a bipartisan call for emergency federal funding to provide transit alternatives and to speed up construction at Penn Station, and I’ll keep working with leaders from both parties at all levels of government to find creative solutions and get the resources we need to get LIRR service back on track.   People need to be able to get to work on time, get home for family dinner, and have time to spend with their kids and loved ones – and a transportation system that prevents any of those things is completely unacceptable.
CONGRATS to the 2017 NCAA DII Women's Lacrosse National Champions Adelphi University Panthers! Making #NY04 proud!!

Pulling out of the Paris Agreement is probably the most irresponsible thing President Trump has done since taking office. His speech today was as ignorant and deceitful as it was offensive to the Long Islanders who are already living with the effects of climate change and whose communities could be under water in a few decades if we fail to stop it.   The consequences of this decision go far beyond the environment. The Paris Agreement was only possible because the U.S. brought the world together to take on a global problem that affects us all. That's what we do. That's what leadership looks like. President Trump is doing the exact opposite, and the entire world is taking notice.

New Democrat Coalition Cybersecurity Task Force wrote to U.S. Office of Personnel Management about how we can improve the process of hiring & retaining cybersecurity experts, and they refused to respond because our letter wasn't signed by a Republican. Now Derek Kilmer and I are demanding answers.

Senate Republicans spent weeks working in secrecy just to come up with a bill that’s just as cruel as what passed in the House and in some ways even worse. The only people whose lives would be better under this legislation are wealthy Americans who get a big tax cut, while millions of Americans lose their insurance and the rest of us are forced to pay more for less coverage. And even though President Trump claims to care about ending the opioid epidemic, this bill would be devastating for people struggling with addiction on Long Island and across the country. Republicans are doing their best to rush this bill to a vote, but my New York colleagues and I will keep standing together and fighting back with everything that we have.

BREAKING: CBO estimates that under GOP health care bill, 22 MILLION more people would be uninsured in the next decade, 15 MILLION in 2018 alone. We need to keep speaking up and fighting to #ProtectOurCare!

Today Kathleen introduced bipartisan legislation to prohibit FEMA claw backs after three years: “Victims of disasters like Sandy use whatever assistance they receive to rebuild their homes and put their lives back together, and it’s not fair for FEMA to try and claw back that money years later because they think they noticed a mistake. While we keep working to waive all debts for homeowners who may have been overpaid through no fault of their own, this bipartisan legislation will impose a three-year statute of limitations on attempts to recoup funds from individuals, as is already the case for states and municipalities.”

It's time for GOP to stop pushing #Trumpcare, abandon repeal, and work with us to improve the ACA and strengthen the individual market. Today I joined nine of my colleagues to offer five common-sense ways we can start.
Another version of #Trumpcare, another attempt to decimate Medicaid and weaken protections for people with preexisting conditions.

I have a message for the NRATV: This is beyond the pale and you are a disgrace to the Constitution you claim to defend. Lunatics actively encouraging violence against the free press.
Calling all coders: We're excited to announce the 2017 Congressional App Challenge for high school students from #NY04! Visit https://go.usa.gov/xRyES to learn more and find out how to apply!

The President of the United States shouldn’t need two days of deliberation to decide that ‘racism is evil’ and condemn groups like the KKK, neo-Nazis and white supremacists. These groups make up the core of the so-called ‘alt-right,’ and it’s hard to take President Trump seriously when he still has alt-right leaders like Steve Bannon, Stephen Miller and Sebastian Gorka serving as top advisers in his administration. All three need to be fired, and all responsible leaders across the political spectrum need to unequivocally reject alt-right extremists and all that they stand for.
Thanks to the Moms Demand Action - NY members who dropped off constituent notes at our #NY04 office yesterday. So grateful to have you all as allies in this fight! #StopCCR

Kathleen's Statement on President Trump's Decision to End DACA: "President Trump’s decision to rescind DACA is a cruel and senseless mistake that Congress must immediately rectify. Dreamers are Americans in every way but their paperwork, and forcing them to once again live in fear of deportation only serves to further divide our country and excite anti-immigrant extremists on the far right. Republicans in Congress who have spoken in support of DACA must now come together with Democrats and take action to ensure that Dreamers can continue to live and work and contribute to their communities without the constant threat of being deported from the only home they’ve ever known. Sending President Trump a bill to protect Dreamers is the least that we can do – and we should follow it by finally taking up comprehensive immigration reform with a path to citizenship for all the millions of hard-working, law-abiding undocumented immigrants living in the shadows of American society."

Kathleen announces nearly $450,000 in security grant funding for six Jewish nonprofits in #NY04: “At a time when acts of anti-Semitism have dramatically increased in the U.S. and the threat of terrorism continues to evolve, one of the most effective things we can do is to help potential targets enhance their security and emergency response capabilities and prepare for worst case scenarios. I’m pleased that we secured this funding to help enhance security measures at Jewish nonprofits in our district, and I’ll continue working to ensure that all of our communities have the resources and support they need to keep people safe.”

MY STATEMENT ON LAS VEGAS SHOOTING: “It’s hard to find the words to express how it feels to once again wake up to reports of the deadliest mass shooting in American history. It’s unlike anything we’ve ever seen before – as many as 58 people dead, more than 500 injured, several in critical condition. But at the same time, it feels like déjà vu.  “Right now, I’m praying for the hundreds of Americans who just lost loved ones and family members and friends. I’m praying for the victims fighting for their lives, for the doctors and nurses and emergency responders working tirelessly to save them, and for all the police officers and firefighters and first responders who risked their lives to save others, who ran towards the threat while helping others get to safety.   “We don’t yet know how or why this happened, what the shooter’s motivation was, how he acquired these weapons, or whether this could have been prevented. The authorities conducting this investigation will try to answer many of those questions for us. But the question of what happens next – whether this will be a turning point, or déjà vu – that’s entirely up to us. It’s up to each and every one of us to decide whether we want to live in a country where public gatherings are dominated by the threat of gun violence. It’s up to us to decide if it’s ok for someone in America to acquire weapons capable of killing 58 people in a few minutes and injure scores more. It’s up to us to decide if we want our police officers and first responders – the heroes we thank and praise after incidents like this – to face that kind of firepower. It’s up to us to decide if this tragedy will finally compel us to act, or if we’ll once again do nothing and wait for another mass shooting to top Las Vegas as the deadliest in American history.  “We can’t prevent every mass shooting in America, but we know without a doubt that we can prevent some. We can’t save every life lost to gun violence in America, but we know that we can save some. The question is whether we care enough to try.”
Joined Dem colleagues and Gabby Giffords on the House steps this morning to honor the victims of the Las Vegas shooting and demand common-sense action to prevent gun violence in America

Great news: Last night the House passed Kathleen's bipartisan bill to extend a key program that helps New York business travelers compete in the Asia Pacific region. “This is a successful program that operates at no cost to taxpayers and makes New York businesses more competitive in the global economy. Permanently reauthorizing this program is a win for New York businesses and for the American economy. I’m grateful that this bill received such broad bipartisan support and I look forward to seeing it signed into law.”

Today I introduced a bill requiring all Members of Congress to receive mandatory annual cybersecurity training. We’re facing a constant threat of cyberattacks on American government, political and private-sector systems, and Members of Congress have a responsibility to protect the integrity of the systems we use every day. Our employees and House officers are already required to take mandatory information security training, and Members should be held to the exact same standard.
Check out my op-ed with fellow New Dem Cybersecurity Task Force co-chairs Rep. Derek Kilmer and Rep Josh Gottheimer about the urgent need for a comprehensive national cybersecurity strategy

Today I introduced a bipartisan bill with Congressman Ryan Costello to help prevent domestic abusers from buying guns: "When domestic abusers can easily buy guns, their partners too often end up dead – that’s what happens when our background check system lacks complete, up-to-date domestic violence records from every state in the country. Our bipartisan bill creates common-sense incentives for states to improve their reporting of domestic violence records so that we can enforce the law, keep guns out of the hands of domestic abusers, and save lives. New York has been a national leader when it comes to reporting domestic violence records, and this bill will help ensure that every state in the country approaches this problem with the same level of commitment.”

Rep. John Conyers should resign. I’ve reviewed the allegations against him, and they're as credible as they are repulsive. The women who reported this behavior suffered serious professional repercussions for doing so, which is exactly why so many victims of sexual harassment and assault decide not to step forward. If men who engage in this behavior suffered real repercussions, more victims would speak up — and maybe other men would decide to act like decent, civilized adults and not prey on women who work for and trust and admire them.  Whether it happened 40 years ago or last week, settlement or no settlement, Democrat or Republican — harassment is harassment, assault is assault. We all know credible allegations when we hear them, and the same is true of hypocrisy.

I believe the women who accused Rep. Conyers. I believe the women who have accused Sen. Franken, Rep. Kihuen, and Rep. Farenthold. And again, I believe all three should resign as Rep. Conyers has. My full statement from this morning:  “When the recent wave of credible allegations of sexual harassment and assault reached Rep. John Conyers, my colleague in the House and a fellow Democrat, I felt we needed to show that we would no longer allow ourselves or our colleagues to be held to a double standard. If we believe the women, as so many of us say we do, then we can’t just go on serving alongside and working with colleagues who we believe have preyed on women – we need to act, and men who have abused their positions of power need to face consequences.   “That’s the standard we expect in the media, in entertainment, and throughout the private sector, and the standard for public servants should if anything be even higher. That doesn’t mean that every politician who faces a single accusation should resign immediately – it means that if we believe the women, we should act accordingly. I believe the women who accused Rep. Conyers. I believe the women who have accused Sen. Franken, Rep. Kihuen, and Rep. Farenthold. And again, I believe all three should resign as Rep. Conyers has.   “I believe and I hope that we’ve made real progress on this issue over the past two weeks. We’ve identified what the standard should be for politicians who violate the public trust by harassing or assaulting women. Now we need to stick to it.”

Honored to present the Congressional Badge of Bravery to Deputy US Marshal Johnny O'Brien from Baldwin #NY04 for the exceptional courage he showed risking his own life to help save a FDNY firefighter who was shot during an operation to apprehend a fugitive gang member. That's the kind of risk law enforcement officials are ready to take for us and for each other every single day, and I couldn't be more grateful to Johnny, his wife NYPD Detective Kristin O'Brien, and all the men and women who put their lives on the line to protect us.
